intro: Chucoa lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf chucoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
